page.title: 16TRANSPORT
page.content: With the survey area being a rural setting, it is surprising for visitors to find such a busy major road running through the villages. Traffic surveys have shown that during daylight hours the average traffic volume using the A 620 exceeds 600 vehicles an hour. Many of the vehicles are heavy lorries transporting coal to the power stations in the Trent Valley.During the recent miner's strike the volume of road traffic was even heavier than usual,and the village streets were blackened by coal dust.Now that things are back to normal the majority of coal is once again transported by rail.
